column5: Looking for a place to fish with grandson for 3-4 days. Definately need to have high success rate dont want Grandson to get bored. Need to get this guy hooked on fishing. Looking for suggestions at resort on a really good lake with LOTS and LOTS of fish. willing to drive to make sure this time is a success. Your suggestions would be greatly appreciated and thank you in advance. Probably going next Spring!
Ontario is a VERY large place so it may help with your question is you say where you live and what part of the province you want to fish in.
How old ? at six they may be fine with a dock and Rock Bass every cast, at 14 not so much.
Id also ask, what species are grandad and dad comfortable fishing for. Theres plenty of great bass lakes, but id still argue you need to have a clue in order to get on the fish.

Depending on how young a bucket full of minnows will keep their attention for hours. Always great for a slow day. There is nothing worse to spoil a fishing trip as great expectations. If they are young teens well good luck. I fished until I was around 12  then nothing until I was in my mid 20's. Sports and most importantly, girls, girls, girls.

If you want fish after fish do a flyin in one of the millions of walleye/pike lakes in this province.  Doesn't get much easier then a jig and twister tail.   When you get bored of that, pick up your med/heavy spinning rod and cast spoons for pike.    Won't find anything easier then this.
